lead_paragraph: Carmen Yulin Cruz, the mayor of San Juan, P.R., hailed a taxi in Greenwich Village on Wednesday night to go back to her hotel in the Bronx. But the driver refused and kicked her out of the cab.

headline.print_headline: Leader Faces Taxi Troubles as She Seeks Trip to Bronx
headline.main: Puerto Rican Mayor Faces Taxi Troubles on a Trip to Bronx

snippet: Carmen Yulin Cruz, the mayor of San Juan, P.R., hailed a taxi in Greenwich Village on Wednesday night to go back to her hotel in the Bronx. But the driver refused and kicked her out of the cab.
abstract: Carmen Yulin Cruz, mayor of San Juan, PR, has difficulty in getting taxi cab ride from Greenwich Village to her hotel in Bronx; second driver takes her to hotel after first driver kicked her and fellow passengers out of cab; city cab drivers cannot legally refuse rides, but some drivers balk at taking passengers to boroughs outside Manhattan.
